summary: This document is an email chain between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding discovery production in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It discusses technical issues with file transfers, redactions in flight records, and logistics for delivering hard drives containing discovery materials to Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, corresponding with prosecutors about discovery production issues, redactions, and logistics for delivering hard drives to the MDC.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on discovery-related emails discussing production errors and redactions.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on emails regarding discovery production and technical issues.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on discovery-related correspondence.

persons.name: Thomas J. Powers
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, involved in dropping off hard drives and copied on discovery discussions.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case, referenced as the recipient of discovery materials at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

connections.description: Both are defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell, collaborating on discovery issues.
Both are defense attorneys on Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team, copied on the same discovery correspondence.
Both are defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell, working together on discovery matters.
Both are defense attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell; Powers physically dropped off hard drives as part of discovery logistics.
Everdell is part of the legal team representing defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Drive Delivery to MDC
events.description: Defense attorneys drop off two hard drives containing discovery materials for Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center, with plans for her to receive them by the government's deadline.

events.title: Scheduled Discovery Production
events.description: Prosecutors plan to have another discovery production ready, including replacement files and a full set of discovery to date for loading onto a new drive.

keyFacts: Defense attorneys raised concerns about redactions in flight records from airlines (American, Delta, Southwest, United) dating back to the 1990s, which were produced pursuant to subpoenas.

Prosecutors stated redactions were applied to flight information from recent flights (within the past decade) that post-date the offense conduct, claiming it is not subject to disclosure under Rule 16.
Technical issues with discovery production included file names being too long and problems with McAfee encryption software, affecting the uploading of files.
Logistical plans were made to provide Ghislaine Maxwell with a single hard drive containing all discovery to date at the MDC, while retrieving prior drives.
The email chain reveals ongoing coordination and disputes between prosecution and defense regarding the scope and format of discovery materials in the Maxwell case.
